tn.text: Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.

tn.ref: Then we turned and took our journey
tn.text: "Then we turned around and went"

tn.ref: we went around Mount Seir for many days
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the Israelites traveled around the mountain called Seir for a very long time or 2) the Israelites wandered in a region called Mount Seir for a very long time.
This is a mountainous area south of the Dead Sea. The area is also called "Edom." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:01|1:2]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Some languages translate this as "many nights."
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.

tn.ref: of your brothers, the descendants of Esau
tn.text: "of your relatives, the descendants of Esau"

tn.ref: I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession
tn.text: Yahweh is reminding the Israelites that he has given this territory to the descendants of Esau.
Moses continues to instruct Israel in how they are to treat the descendants of Esau.

tn.ref: You will purchase food from them
tn.text: Yahweh is giving them permission or instruction, not a command, and he is telling them not to steal. "I permit you to purchase food from them" or "If you need food, you are to purchase it from them"
"from Esau's descendants"
If these words are not needed or make the translation unclear, you may omit them.

tn.ref: your God has blessed you ... your hand ... your walking ... your God ... with you, and you have lacked
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you in all the work of your hand
tn.text: The "work of your hand" refers to all the work they had done. AT: "all of your work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This is a synecdoche for "he knows what has happened to you while you have been walking." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"40 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is a litotes for "you have had everything you needed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
"by our relatives"
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is an idiom. AT: "we kept going" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is the end of a part of Moses' speech reminding the Israelites of how Yahweh guided them in the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
The word "Moab" is a synecdoche for the people of Moab. AT: "Do not trouble the people of Moab" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This is the name of a city in Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The people of Israel were related to the descendants of Moab. Moab was the son of Lot. Lot was the nephew of Abraham. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The writer begins to give background information about the people of the land. These words are not part of Moses' speech to the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: The Emim lived ... call them the Emim
tn.text: These words give background information about the Emim people, who had lived in the land before the Moabites. Your language may have a special way to mark background information. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
These are names of people groups that were considered giants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are descendants of the Anak people who were very large and fierce. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:26|1:28]].
This continues the background information about the different people groups that had lived in the land. (See: [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:12|2:10-11]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]]).
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"killed all of them so none of them were left living with them" or "removed them from their presence by killing all of them"
Moses continues reminding the Israelites of what had happened to them in the wilderness.
"'Then Yahweh said, "Now rise up ... Zered.' So." This can be translated as an indirect quote. AT: "Then Yahweh told us to rise up ... Zered. So" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
begin to do something (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This stream flows into the Dead Sea from the southeast and creates the border between Edom and Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

The word "now" marks a change from the story to background information about how long the people of Israel traveled and about God's anger towards that generation. If your language has a way of showing that what follows is background information, you should use it here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
eight years** - "38 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is a polite way of saying "had died." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: the hand of Yahweh was against
tn.text: Here "the hand of Yahweh" refers to Yahweh's power. AT: "Yahweh used his power against" or "Yahweh punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel of what happened in the past.

tn.ref: You are ... you come ... do not trouble ... give you
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and the command "do not trouble" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is the name of a city in Moab. See how you translated "Ar" in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:09|2:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The people of Israel were related to the descendants of Ammon. Ammon was the son of Lot. Lot was the nephew of Abraham. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

These verses begin to give background information about the people groups who lived in the land. If your language has a way of showing that what follows is background information, you should use it here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "People also consider that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a people group. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:10|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is another name for the Rephaim people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a people group. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:26|1:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"allowed the Ammonites to defeat them" or "allowed the Ammonites to kill them all"

tn.ref: they succeeded them and lived in their place
tn.text: "the Ammonites took over everything the Rephaim had owned and have lived where the Rephaim had lived"
This is the name of a people group. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:12|2:12]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: succeeded them and have lived in their place
tn.text: "took over everything the Horites had owned and have lived where the Horites had lived"
The writer finishes describing how God enabled Esau to conquer the land Esau is now inhabiting.
These are names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. It may be another name for the island of Crete located in the Mediterranean Sea. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"destroyed the Avvim"
"lived where the Avvim had lived"
The writer has finished giving background information and is now again telling what Moses said to the Israelites.
Yahweh is telling Moses what the people should do. "Now get up" or "Now go."
"continue your journey"
This is the name of the valley of the Arnon River. It creates the border between Moab and the Amorites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: I have given into your hand
tn.text: The metonym "into your hand" means "into your control or power." AT: "I have given you the power to defeat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: your hand ... Begin to possess it ... fight ... terror of you ... news about you ... because of you
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" and the commands "begin to possess" and "fight" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is the name of a king. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a city. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"fight against him and his army"
The words "fear" and "terror" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that the fear is intense. AT: "put a terrible fear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: peoples that are under the whole sky
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "peoples in every land" ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is hendiadys and emphasizes that the people will "tremble in anguish." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
Here "I" refers to Moses.
This is the name of a place near the valley of Arnon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of a man and a place. See how you translated them in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here the metonym "words of peace" means "with my offer of peace" or "with a message from me asking for peace." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left
tn.text: This phrase emphasizes that they will always go in the same direction. It can be stated in positive form. "I will not change direction" or "I will always stay on the path" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
This continues Moses' message to King Sihon.

tn.ref: You will sell me food for money, so that I may eat; give me water for money, so that I may drink
tn.text: Moses tells Sihon that the Israelites will not steal from the Amorites and requests that Sihon and his people sell food and water to the Israelites; he is not giving a command. AT: "I expect to have to pay for food so I can eat and to pay for water so I can drink"

tn.ref: sell me ... I may eat ... give me ... I may drink
tn.text: Moses is referring to the people of Israel as if they were Moses himself. AT: "sell to me and my people ... we may eat ... give us ... we may drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: only let me pass through on my feet
tn.text: "only let us walk through your land"
This is the name of a place. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:09|2:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Moses continues to remind the people of what happened in the past.
These are the names of a man and a place. See how you translated them in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: hardened his mind and made his heart obstinate
tn.text: Both of these phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh "caused him to become very stubborn." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: to deliver up Sihon and his land before you
tn.text: "to give Sihon and his land over to you"

tn.ref: begin to possess it, in order that you may inherit his land
tn.text: "take possession of his land, so that you may inherit it"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel about what happened in the past.
This is the name of a man. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a city in Moab (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Moses continues reminding the people about what happened in the past.
"We captured all of King Sihon's cities"
"killed all the people who lived in every city"
This is the name of a city on the north bank of the Arnon River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Arnon" is the name of a river. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:02:24|2:24]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: there was not a city too high for us
tn.text: This negative statement is used to emphasize their success in battle. This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "we were able to defeat the people of every city even if the city had high walls around it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is the name of a river that created the border between Sihon's land and the land of the Ammonites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
